title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.13.44 | 22-10-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम ग्यानति मिरान्धस्य ज्यानान्जनिषलाकया चक्षुरुन्मीलितं येनातस्मै श्री गुरवे नमः
नमा ओम विष्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्रीमते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्नितिनामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गौरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेश शुन्यवादी पाश्चात्यदेशतारिने
जाय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभूनित्यानन्दा श्री अद्वैतगणाधर श्रीवासादी गौरभक्तवृन्दा
हरे कृष्णा हरे कृष्णा कृष्ण कृष्णा हरे हरे हरे राम हरे रामा राम रामा हरे हरे
ओम नमो भगवते वासु देवाया नारायणम नमस्कृत्य नरम चेवन अरोत्तमं देवीम सरस्वतीम व्यासम ततो जयमुदी रयेत
In this session we will be discussing from the 44th verse of the 13th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
यन मन्यसे ध्रुवं लोकं अध्रुवं वा नचो भयं सर्वथा नही शोच्चास्ते स्नेहाद अन्यत्र मोहजात
The meaning of this verse is
O King, in all circumstances, whether you consider the soul to be an eternal principle,
or the material body to be perishable,
or everything to exist in the impersonal absolute truth,
or everything to be an inexplicable combination of matter and spirit,
feelings of separation are due only to illusory affection and nothing more.
A technical verse, and it explains perfectly the philosophy of Krishna Kaalabhata.
As the perfect explanation of the reality of the truth in this world.
About what is this world, or who we are,
or what is actually going on, the basis for things to take place in this world.
Bhagavatam, and the followers of the Bhagavata philosophy, the pure devotees,
they give the perfect understanding based on the complete knowledge about the reality.
Because the other philosophers are not able to see the complete reality.
They are ignorant about certain facts, or certain facets of reality.
Just like the materialists do not know anything about the soul.
If they don't know anything about the soul, then they do not know anything about the supreme soul either.
So they don't take spiritual reality into consideration.
Which is always in the background of the material reality.
Even the material reality, different philosophers have different degrees of understanding.
Different philosophies have different degrees of understanding.
Different religions have different degrees of understanding.
Different religions have different degrees of understanding of what is matter.
Some people do not even know...
that matter means the five elements, gross matter, consists of five elements combined in different proportions.
It consists of five elements combined in different proportions.
And it comes into existence by the combination of the five elements in different proportions when it is created.
It remains for some time, and then it is separated again back to the five elements.
This is what is going on as far as all the material objects are concerned.
And this is happening not by any person's endeavor, but by the actions and reactions of the material modes of nature.
This reality is not known to the modern day scientists.
They don't even know what are these five elements.
So, here, Naramuni is presenting the fact that whatever be one's understanding of the present reality,
feelings of separation, which any two people experience who are separated, are only due to illusory affection.

So, here, Naramuni is presenting the fact that whatever be one's understanding of the present reality, feelings of separation, which any two people experience who are separated, are only due to illusory affection.
So, here, Naramuni is presenting the fact that whatever be one's understanding of the present reality, feelings of separation, are only due to illusory affection.
We have an affection for some of our near and dear ones.
And when we are separated from somebody whom we have got an affectionate relationship, we feel the pangs of separation.
And we desire that we again are able to come together and stay as well-wishers of each other.
